thread.title: Chris Webber was not happy with a question about Jalen Rose
thread.title_full: Chris Webber was not happy with a question about Jalen Rose

author: tmachir@sportingnews.com (Troy Machir)
title: Chris Webber was not happy with a question about Jalen Rose
text:
Chris Webber was not happy with a question about Jalen Rose Sporting News 1 day ago tmachir@sportingnews.com (Troy Machir) © John Biever/Sports Illustrated/Getty Images University of Michigan's Chris Webber and Jalen Rose sit on the bench during their game against Indiana in Bloomington, IN on Feb. 14, 1993. The "Fab Five" Michigan squad of the early 1990's is one of the most iconic and controversial units in college basketball history. The group, made up of Jalen Rose, Juwan Howard, Jimmy King, Ray Jackson and Chris Webber changed the culture of college basketball.
AdChoices Four of the members of the group have spoke about the controversy surrounding their recruitment and NCAA investigation. Chris Webber, arguably the most famous of the group, refuses to talk about it. When Jalen Rose lead ESPN's critically acclaimed "30 for 30" on the team, Webber was the only one not involved.
MORE: Best Michigan players of all time | Jalen Rose talks recruiting visits | Time to move on from "Fab Five"
His relationship with Rose is virtually nonexistent, and as CBS radio host Doug Gottlieb found out on Thursday, Webber does not want to talk about it.
Webber joined Gottlieb to talk about his upcoming position teaching a master class in Wake Forest University's film program, and when Gottlieb attempted to broach the subject of his relationship with Rose, Webber shut him down.
Gottlieb: "Where are you with Jalen?"
Webber: "What did you ask me?"
Gottlieb: "I said 'where are you with Jalen,' in terms of your relationship?"
Webber: "Wherever it was."
(Gottlieb attempts to reiterate question)
Webber: "I mean, Doug, we ain’t talking about that. You ain’t getting that interview. I’m talking about Wake Forest. I don’t talk about him. I talked about him one time on 'The Dan Patrick Show.' That was it."
(Gottlieb attempts to rephrase question)
Webber: "Come on Doug. I just told you respectfully on your show I’m not going to talk about it. I’m talking about being a professor at Wake Forest teaching a class on culture in sports. Now do want want to beat me up because I did not answer you on your show?"
Gottlieb: "No, Chris. I want to make sure to give you context for why I asked."
Webber: "I don’t want to answer the question. So what would you ask me after that? Because I’m going to put this in for my class, as far as how did you handle the media. I’m going to show them right now. I don't want to answer that question. I respectfully ask you not to ask me that again so you can blow your numbers up for your show. I don’t want to talk about that, Doug."
Gottlieb: "And what I was trying to tell you was —"
Webber: "I understand, but you’re trying to still talk about this subject."
Gottlieb: "No no no, I’m not. I’m actually not, Chris. I’m actually not. I didn’t know coming in, I didn’t ask to have you on the show with that as the sole purpose, to try and get that out of you, but I wouldn’t be doing my —"
Webber: Okay, so as soon as I said 'no,' we can leave that alone."
Gottlieb: "But I wouldn’t be doing my job if I didn’t ask you, and give you the ability, if you had the desire to do so, to speak on it."
Webber: "Thank you for the ability, and I again say I don’t want to talk about it."
Gottlieb : "And I’m alright with that. And I’m alright with that. I just want you to know is part of doing this job is you have to ask."
Webber: "I don’t know what it’s like to do your job Doug, so thank you for explaining that to me."
Gottlieb: "Hey listen, thanks for joining us, I didn’t want to turn it into any sort of back and forth, I just tried to ask a question that you didn’t’ want to answer. But I do respect what you’re doing and I thank you for coming on."
Webber: "I hope the students sign up because the class is going to be way more fun than this interview. It’s going to be crazy. Thank you."
You can listen to the full interview here .
Source: Uproxx
